The #USMCA will strengthen our auto industries and our economy. The United States Trade Representative estimates that USMCA will add $34 billion in automotive investment and create 76000 American jobs over 5 years.
46 of 50 states count Canada or Mexico as their first or second-largest foreign purchasers— including Ohio. The #USMCA reinforces our nation’s strong manufacturing ties with our top trading partners.
Delaying the passage of the #USMCA hurts the U.S. manufacturing sector and workers. U.S. exports of manufactured goods to Canada and Mexico support more than 2 million jobs across the United States.

Canada and Mexico are the largest foreign purchasers of American manufactured goods. The #USMCA maintains the successful duty-free access for U.S. manufactured goods into our North American neighbors.

That’s why earlier this year I cosponsored and today voted yes on legislation to authorize funding the September 11th Victim Compensation Fund through 2090 so our nation’s heroes and their families can be guaranteed the benefits they deserve.
Our nation made a vow to never forget the tragic events that unfolded on September 11 2001 or the first responders who gave or risked their lives to save fellow Americans.

This legislation known as the Craft Beverage Modernization and Tax Reform Act would give our local breweries the opportunity to keep hiring and investing in our local communities.

The current tax code that grants small breweries a break on the federal excise tax is set to expire; we should make it permanent to ensure that these small businesses have a chance to compete and grow.
This week at @WaysandMeansGOP I advocated to make permanent an expiring tax provision that is helping small craft breweries and distilleries – including the favorites we all have in Cincinnati.
